searchParameters.q: site:square-enix.com ("DDoS protection" OR "DDoS mitigation" OR "protected against DDoS" OR "attack prevention")

organic.title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Forum
organic.snippet: It's not as simple as "get some DDoS protection" - I'm sure that SE, like every business with servers, has as much DDOS "protection" as they can get. But these attacks are variable and random, and they've having to analyze what's happening as it happens in order to understand and stop it.

organic.title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Forum
organic.snippet: No MMO is going to invest hundreds of millions into DDoS protection when these attacks don't cost them anywhere near that much. The big tech companies cannot afford to go down globally for a day, FFXIV can. It's just a fact. But given you omitted that part and strawmanned the post into a criticism ...

organic.title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Forum
organic.snippet: DDoS "Protection" is more about mitigating the effects of it rather than actually preventing it. 2) The ultimate equation, is it even worth it? Being blunt, consumers are short term memory creatures by far and large. There was another point in this game's history that it had frequent DDoS attacks ...

organic.title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Forum
organic.snippet: The only time you can truly test if ddos mitigation works, is if you dont put your servers down. If the servers are down, ddos attacks are more likely to be stopped/sources detected. Yet thats meaningless in that case as the damage is already done at that point (the server is down as the ddos ...

organic.title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Forum
organic.snippet: Ok. A tracert to a lobby server address shows SE uses NTT.NET network services, and checking the NTT website shows that NTT.NET provides DDOS protection as a service. So I assume that NTT is trying as hard as they can to stop these DDOS attacks. Last edited by WindyGamer; 07-31-2019 at 05:36 AM ...

organic.title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Forum
organic.snippet: The DDoS protection made me get high latency from the west coast of the US, and I don't mean the average latency I'd get in other games, but rather twice it. It's bad when you need to use a tunnel to connect to something on the same continent. Reply With Quote · Imora's Avatar. Imora said:Player 07-20 ...

organic.title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Forum
organic.snippet: Hang on a second here, in terms of AoEs:- Holy stuns, Gravity is ranged, Art of War and Dyskrasia are instant cast. We have no shortage of mobility (or attack prevention in WHM's case) in our AoE spells. Our single target casts are no different to RDM in terms of stationary time. Valkyrie_'s Avatar.
